options.text: "Who's up for a friendly game? Small stakes only."
options.resultText: The dice favor you tonight. You rake in a modest pot as your lance mates good-naturedly grumble about their losses.

reward_choices.prompt: What do you do with your winnings?

options.text: Keep the winnings (+15 gold)
options.tooltip: Pocket the coin - you earned it fair and square

options.text: Buy rounds for everyone (+4 Lance Rep)
options.tooltip: Spend your winnings to treat the lance - builds camaraderie

options.text: Keep half, treat the lance (+7 gold, +2 Lance Rep)
options.tooltip: A balanced approach - profit and goodwill

options.outcome_failure: The dice betray you utterly. You lose your stake and then some. A few lance mates shoot you sympathetic looks as you count your remaining coins.
options.text: "Let's make this interesting. High stakes tonight."
options.resultText: Lady luck smiles upon you! You rake in a substantial pot, earning respect for your boldness. Some grumble about their losses, but such is the game.

options.text: Actually, maybe another night.
options.resultText: You decide to save your coin for another evening. Rest is more valuable tonight.

events.title: Organize a Dice Game
events.setup: The evening settles over camp, and you consider gathering some lance mates for a round of dice. It's a good way to pass the time and build camaraderie - though gambling always carries some risk.

options.text: "Sergeant, I'd like some extra training."
options.resultText: The drillmaster nods. "Right then. What do you want to work on?"

reward_choices.prompt: Which area do you want to train?

options.text: One-Handed Weapons (+40 One-Handed)
options.tooltip: Sword and shield technique, strikes and parries

options.text: Two-Handed Weapons (+40 Two-Handed)
options.tooltip: Great axes, swords, and hammers - powerful strikes

options.text: Polearms (+40 Polearm)
options.tooltip: Spears, pikes, and glaives - reach and formation combat

options.text: Archery (+40 Bow)
Crossbow (+40 Crossbow)
Horsemanship (+40 Riding)
Physical Conditioning (+40 Athletics)
options.tooltip: Running, climbing, endurance - the foundation of soldiering

options.text: On second thought, I'll rest instead.
options.resultText: You decide to conserve your energy. Training can wait for another day.

events.title: Request Extra Training
events.setup: The drillmaster is available, and you could ask for some additional instruction. It would be exhausting, but the improvement might be worth it.

options.text: Spend time with the wounded, offering what comfort you can.
options.resultText: You sit with the wounded, sharing stories and checking on their recovery. The medics appreciate the help keeping spirits up. Word spreads that you're the sort who looks after their own.

options.text: I'll visit another time.

events.title: Visit the Wounded
events.setup: The medical tent holds several of your wounded comrades. A visit might lift their spirits - and yours. It's the right thing to do.

options.text: "My Lord, I humbly request an advance on my wages."
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME} considers your request, then nods. "I trust you'll repay this faith with loyal service." A purse of coins is handed to you. The quartermaster notes it down.

options.text: "My Lord, I wish to bring my service to your attention."
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME} listens as you recount your recent actions. "Your dedication is noted, soldier. Continue to serve well." You feel the weight of his regard - a valuable thing.

options.text: Perhaps this is not the right time.
options.resultText: You step back without making your request. Better to wait for a more opportune moment.

events.title: Petition the Lord
events.setup: Your rank allows you to request a brief audience with the Lord. This is not something to do lightly - you must have a purpose, or risk wasting his time.

options.text: Write a reassuring letter, downplaying the dangers.
options.resultText: You craft a letter full of small triumphs and omitted hardships. It feels good to write, to remember there's a world beyond war. You hand it to the camp courier.

options.text: Write an honest account of your experiences.
options.resultText: The words flow more freely than expected. It's cathartic to put the truth on paper, even if it might worry those who read it.

options.text: I'll write when I have more to say.
options.resultText: You set aside the parchment. The words aren't coming today.

events.title: Write a Letter Home
events.setup: You have a moment of quiet. Perhaps it's time to send word home - to family, friends, or whoever waits for your return. Ink and parchment aren't hard to come by.

options.text: Call it in: smooth things over and keep the company steady.
options.resultText: A quiet word, a quiet exchange. The wagons run smoother for a while, and the men complain a little less. The quartermaster's favor is spent.

options.text: Hold it: I'll save that favor for a worse day.
options.resultText: You keep the favor in your pocket. In this life, leverage is a kind of coin.

events.title: Call in a Quartermaster Favor
events.setup: The quartermaster owes you one. You could call in that favor to ease the pressure â€” or keep it for later.

description: Player-initiated decisions - always available from the Pending Decisions menu
